data.title: What is it like to live in South Grafton, New South Wales
data.meta_description: Are you considering migrating to South Grafton in New South Wales, Australia? With so many diverse and beautiful places to choose from throughout Australia,
data.text:
21

Are you considering migrating to South Grafton in New South Wales, Australia? With so many diverse and beautiful places to choose from throughout Australia, it can be overwhelming to decide where to eventually call home.

Each Australian state, city and town has its unique charm and opportunities, and in this article, we will explore what it’s like to live in South Grafton in New South Wales.

South Grafton may well be the place you eventually choose to call home. At the very least, we hope the information contained in our guide helps you weigh the pros and cons of living in South Grafton when compared to some of the other locations we also have profiled within our Living in Australia section.

If you have any questions or comments about living in South Grafton, please feel free to add them via the comment section at the end of our article.

What is it like to live in South Grafton, New South Wales?

Are you interested in moving to South Grafton in New South Wales, Australia? Below you’ll find an overview of South Grafton to help you better understand if South Grafton is the type of place you’d eventually like to call home.

Introduction

South Grafton is a small town located in New South Wales, Australia. The town is situated on the Clarence River and is surrounded by lush green hills. It is a popular tourist destination due to its natural beauty and its proximity to the coast. South Grafton is home to a diverse population and has a vibrant culture and history. The town is known for its stunning natural scenery and its friendly and welcoming locals.

South Grafton Population

As of the 2016 census, South Grafton had a population of 6,917 people. Of this population, 53.3% were male and 46.7% were female. The median age of the population was 33 years old. The majority of the population (78.2%) were born in Australia, while the remaining 21.8% were born overseas.

Population Growth in South Grafton

South Grafton has experienced a steady population growth over the past decade. In 2011, the population was 6,542, and in 2016 it had grown to 6,917. This represents a growth rate of 5.6%.

South Grafton Migrant Population

The migrant population in South Grafton is quite diverse. The most common countries of birth for migrants in South Grafton are England (7.8%), New Zealand (4.7%), and India (3.7%). Other countries of birth include China, the Philippines, and South Africa.

Weather in South Grafton

South Grafton has a temperate climate with mild winters and warm summers. The average annual temperature is 18.7°C (65.7°F). The average maximum temperature is 23.9°C (75.0°F) and the average minimum temperature is 13.5°C (56.3°F). The wettest month is January, with an average rainfall of 122.5mm (4.8in).

Housing in South Grafton

The housing market in South Grafton is quite affordable. The median house price is $320,000, and the median rental price is $350 per week. The majority of the housing in South Grafton is detached houses, with a small percentage of apartments and units.

Crime in South Grafton

South Grafton has a low crime rate. The town has a crime rate of 2,939 per 100,000 people, which is lower than the national average of 3,605 per 100,000 people. The most common type of crime in South Grafton is property-related crime, such as vandalism and theft.

South Grafton Infrastructure

South Grafton has a well-developed infrastructure. The town is served by the Pacific Highway, which connects it to the major cities of Sydney and Brisbane. The town is also served by the Clarence Valley Regional Airport, which provides domestic and international flights.

Public Transport in South Grafton

Public transport in South Grafton is provided by the Clarence Valley Regional Council. The town is served by a network of buses and trains, which connect it to the surrounding towns and cities.

Schools in South Grafton

South Grafton is home to several schools, including South Grafton Public School, St Joseph’s Primary School, and Grafton High School. The schools offer a range of educational opportunities for students of all ages.

Health Facilities in South Grafton

South Grafton is served by several health facilities, including Grafton Base Hospital, South Grafton Medical Centre, and Grafton Physiotherapy Centre. The hospitals and medical centres provide a range of services, from general health care to specialist treatments.

Shopping Centres in South Grafton

South Grafton is home to several shopping centres, including Grafton Shoppingworld, Grafton Central Shopping Centre, and Grafton Mall. The shopping centres offer a range of retail stores and services, from clothing stores to supermarkets.

Main Employment Opportunities in South Grafton

The main employment opportunities in South Grafton are in the health care, education, and retail sectors. The town is also home to several manufacturing plants, which provide employment opportunities in the manufacturing industry.

Parks and Recreation in South Grafton

South Grafton is home to several parks and recreational areas, including the South Grafton Recreation Reserve, South Grafton Park, and the Clarence River Walkway. The parks offer a range of activities, including walking, cycling, and picnicking.

Interesting Facts about South Grafton

South Grafton is home to the oldest surviving bridge in Australia, the Grafton Bridge. The bridge was built in 1876 and is still in use today. The town is also home to the first commercial radio station in Australia, 2GF, which was established in 1925.

Conclusion

South Grafton is a small town located in New South Wales, Australia. The town is known for its stunning natural beauty and its friendly and welcoming locals. South Grafton has a diverse population and a vibrant culture and history. The town is served by a well-developed infrastructure and offers a range of employment opportunities. South Grafton is also home to several parks and recreational areas, as well as a range of shopping centres and health facilities. The town is an ideal destination for those looking to explore the natural beauty of New South Wales.

Are you interested in living in South Grafton?

Is South Grafton on your shortlists of places you’d eventually like to call home? If it is and you have any questions about living in South Grafton, please don’t hesitate to ask in the comments below. If you are familiar with South Grafton, we also welcome your thoughts and experiences. Additionally, if you have knowledge about South Grafton, we encourage you to share it and help others by answering any questions they may have about the area. Your insights will be greatly appreciated by those considering a move to South Grafton.
